elemental.js.util
Class JsGlobals

java.lang.Object
  elemental.js.util.JsGlobals

public class JsGlobals
extends java.lang.Object

A utility class for accessing global functions and values in an ECMAScript context.

parseInt

public static double parseInt(java.lang.String value)
Produces a integral value by interpreting the contents of value as a integer literal. The value returned by this method will be an integral value or NaN, so the return value is a double. 
 Example use:
 // Will yield zero if s is not a valid integer.
 int value = (int)parseInt(s);
 
 // To check if the value is valid.
 double value = parseInt(s);
 if (isNaN(value))
   //Invalid value.

parseInt

public static double parseInt(java.lang.String value,
                              int radix)
Produces a integral value by interpreting the contents of value as a integer literal. The value returned by this method will be an integral value or NaN, so the return value is a double. 
 Example use:
 // Will yield zero if s is not a valid integer.
 int value = (int)parseInt(s);
 
 // To check if the value is valid.
 double value = parseInt(s);
 if (isNaN(value))
   //Invalid value.
